defs.name: canonicalize
defs.value: pub async fn canonicalize<P: AsRef<Path>>(P) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Returns the canonical form of a path.

attributes.value: / Returns the canonical form of a path.
/ The returned path is in absolute form with all intermediate components normalized and symbolic
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * `path` does not point to an existing file or directory.
/ * A non-final component in `path` is not a directory.

defs.name: copy
defs.value: pub async fn copy<P: AsRef<Path>, Q: AsRef<Path>>(P, Q) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Copies a file to a new location.

attributes.value: / Copies a file to a new location.
/ On success, the total number of bytes copied is returned and equals the length of the `dst`
/ The old contents of `dst` will be overwritten. If `src` and `dst` both point to the same
/ file, then the file will likely get truncated as a result of this operation.
/ If you're working with open [`File`]s and want to copy contents through those types, use
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * `src` does not point to an existing file.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to read `src` or write `dst`.

defs.name: create_dir
defs.value: pub async fn create_dir<P: AsRef<Path>>(P) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Creates a directory.

attributes.value: / Note that this function will only create the final directory in `path`. If you want to create
/ all of its missing parent directories too, use [`create_dir_all()`] instead.
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * `path` already points to an existing file or directory.
/ * A parent directory in `path` does not exist.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to create the directory.

defs.name: create_dir_all
defs.value: pub async fn create_dir_all<P: AsRef<Path>>(P) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Creates a directory and its parent directories if they are missing.

attributes.value: / Creates a directory and its parent directories if they are missing.
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * `path` already points to an existing file or directory.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to create the directory or its missing parents.

defs.name: hard_link
defs.value: pub async fn hard_link<P: AsRef<Path>, Q: AsRef<Path>>(P, Q) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Creates a hard link on the filesystem.

attributes.value: / Creates a hard link on the filesystem.
/ The `dst` path will be a link pointing to the `src` path. Note that operating systems often
/ require these two paths to be located on the same filesystem.
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * `src` does not point to an existing file.

defs.name: metadata
defs.value: pub async fn metadata<P: AsRef<Path>>(P) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Reads metadata for a path.

attributes.value: / This function will traverse symbolic links to read metadata for the target file or directory.
/ If you want to read metadata without following symbolic links, use [`symlink_metadata()`]
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * `path` does not point to an existing file or directory.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to read metadata for the path.

defs.name: read
defs.value: pub async fn read<P: AsRef<Path>>(P) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Reads the entire contents of a file as raw bytes.

attributes.value: / Reads the entire contents of a file as raw bytes.
/ This is a convenience function for reading entire files. It pre-allocates a buffer based on the
/ file size when available, so it is typically faster than manually opening a file and reading
/ If you want to read the contents as a string, use [`read_to_string()`] instead.
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * `path` does not point to an existing file.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to read the file.

defs.name: read_dir
defs.value: pub async fn read_dir<P: AsRef<Path>>(P) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Returns a stream of entries in a directory.

attributes.value: / Returns a stream of entries in a directory.
/ The stream yields items of type [`io::Result`]`<`[`DirEntry`]`>`. Note that I/O errors can
/ occur while reading from the stream.
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * `path` does not point to an existing directory.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to read the contents of the directory.

defs.name: metadata
defs.value: pub async fn metadata<'_>(&'_ Self) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Reads the metadata for this entry.

attributes.value: / Reads the metadata for this entry.
/ This function will traverse symbolic links to read the metadata.
/ If you want to read metadata without following symbolic links, use [`symlink_metadata()`]
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * This entry does not point to an existing file or directory anymore.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to read the metadata.

defs.name: file_type
defs.value: pub async fn file_type<'_>(&'_ Self) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Reads the file type for this entry.

attributes.value: / Reads the file type for this entry.
/ This function will not traverse symbolic links if this entry points at one.
/ If you want to read metadata with following symbolic links, use [`metadata()`] instead.
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * This entry does not point to an existing file or directory anymore.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to read this entry's metadata.

defs.name: read_to_string

defs.docs: Reads the entire contents of a file as a string.

attributes.value: / Reads the entire contents of a file as a string.
/ This is a convenience function for reading entire files. It pre-allocates a string based on the
/ file size when available, so it is typically faster than manually opening a file and reading
/ If you want to read the contents as raw bytes, use [`read()`] instead.
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * `path` does not point to an existing file.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to read the file.
/ * The contents of the file cannot be read as a UTF-8 string.

/ and all of its contents, use [`remove_dir_all()`] instead.

defs.name: recursive
defs.value: pub fn recursive(&mut Self, bool) -> &mut Self
defs.docs: Sets the option for recursive mode.

attributes.value: / Sets the option for recursive mode.
/ When set to `true`, this option means all parent directories should be created recursively
/ if they don't exist. Parents are created with the same permissions as the final directory.
/ This option is initially set to `false`.

/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * `path` already points to an existing file or directory.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to create the directory or its missing parents.

defs.name: open

defs.docs: Opens a file in read-only mode.

attributes.value: / Opens a file in read-only mode.
/ See the [`OpenOptions::open()`] function for more options.
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * `path` does not point to an existing file.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to read the file.
/ For more details, see the list of errors documented by [`OpenOptions::open()`].

defs.name: create
defs.value: pub async fn create<P: AsRef<Path>>(P) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Opens a file in write-only mode.

attributes.value: / Opens a file in write-only mode.
/ This method will create a file if it does not exist, and will truncate it if it does.
/ See the [`OpenOptions::open`] function for more options.
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * The file's parent directory does not exist.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to write to the file.
/ For more details, see the list of errors documented by [`OpenOptions::open()`].

defs.name: sync_all
defs.value: pub async fn sync_all<'_>(&'_ Self) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Synchronizes OS-internal buffered contents and metadata to disk.

attributes.value: / Synchronizes OS-internal buffered contents and metadata to disk.
/ This function will ensure that all in-memory data reaches the filesystem.
/ This can be used to handle errors that would otherwise only be caught by closing the file.
/ When a file is dropped, errors in synchronizing this in-memory data are ignored.

defs.name: OpenOptions
defs.docs: A builder for opening files with configurable options.

attributes.value: / A builder for opening files with configurable options.
/ Files can be opened in [`read`][`OpenOptions::read()`] and/or
/ The [`append`][`OpenOptions::append()`] option opens files in a special writing mode that
/ moves the file cursor to the end of file before every write operation.
/ It is also possible to [`truncate`][`OpenOptions::truncate()`] the file right after opening,
/ to [`create`][`OpenOptions::create()`] a file if it doesn't exist yet, or to always create a
/ Open a file for both reading and writing, and create it if it doesn't exist yet:

/ If the file already exists, write calls on it will overwrite the previous contents without

defs.name: append
defs.value: pub fn append(&mut Self, bool) -> &mut OpenOptions
defs.docs: Configures the option for append mode.

attributes.value: / Configures the option for append mode.
/ When set to `true`, this option means the file will be writable after opening and the file
/ cursor will be moved to the end of file before every write operaiton.

defs.docs: Configures the option for truncating the previous file.

attributes.value: / Configures the option for truncating the previous file.
/ When set to `true`, the file will be truncated to the length of 0 bytes.
/ The file must be opened in [`write`][`OpenOptions::write()`] or

defs.name: create
defs.value: pub fn create(&mut Self, bool) -> &mut OpenOptions
defs.docs: Configures the option for creating a new file if it doesn't exist.

attributes.value: / Configures the option for creating a new file if it doesn't exist.
/ When set to `true`, this option means a new file will be created if it doesn't exist.
/ The file must be opened in [`write`][`OpenOptions::write()`] or
/ [`append`][`OpenOptions::append()`] mode for file creation to work.

defs.name: create_new
defs.value: pub fn create_new(&mut Self, bool) -> &mut OpenOptions
defs.docs: Configures the option for creating a new file or failing if it already exists.

attributes.value: / Configures the option for creating a new file or failing if it already exists.
/ When set to `true`, this option means a new file will be created, or the open operation
/ will fail if the file already exists.
/ The file must be opened in [`write`][`OpenOptions::write()`] or
/ [`append`][`OpenOptions::append()`] mode for file creation to work.

defs.name: open
defs.value: pub fn open<P: AsRef<Path>>(&Self, P) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Opens a file with the configured options.

attributes.value: / Opens a file with the configured options.
/ An error will be returned in the following situations:
/ * The file does not exist and neither [`create`] nor [`create_new`] were set.
/ * The file's parent directory does not exist.
/ * The current process lacks permissions to open the file in the configured mode.
/ * The file already exists and [`create_new`] was set.
/ * Invalid combination of options was used, like [`truncate`] was set but [`write`] wasn't,
/   or none of [`read`], [`write`], and [`append`] modes was set.
/ * An OS-level occurred, like too many files are open or the file name is too long.

defs.name: mode
defs.value: pub fn mode(&mut Self, u32) -> &mut Self
defs.docs: Sets the mode bits that a new file will be created with.

attributes.value: / Sets the mode bits that a new file will be created with.
/ If a new file is created as part of an [`OpenOptions::open()`] call then this
/ specified `mode` will be used as the permission bits for the new file.
/ If no `mode` is set, the default of `0o666` will be used.
/ The operating system masks out bits with the system's `umask`, to produce
/ // Read/write permissions for owner and read permissions for others.

defs.name: custom_flags
defs.value: pub fn custom_flags(&mut Self, i32) -> &mut Self
defs.docs: Passes custom flags to the `flags` argument of `open`.

attributes.value: / Passes custom flags to the `flags` argument of `open`.
/ The bits that define the access mode are masked out with `O_ACCMODE`, to
/ ensure they do not interfere with the access mode set by Rust's options.
/ Custom flags can only set flags, not remove flags set by Rust's options.
/ This options overwrites any previously set custom flags.
